qas.question: What major typeface font was started by The Times?
Who was the creator of typeface font used by The Times?
In November 2006, The Times changed its font to what new font typeface?
How long was The Times printed in broadsheet format?
In what year did The Times change its broadsheet format to a compact size?

context: The Times is the originator of the widely used <a0_0>Times Roman<a0_0/> typeface, originally developed by <a1_0>Stanley Morison<a1_0/> of The Times in collaboration with the Monotype Corporation for its legibility in low-tech printing. In November 2006 The Times began printing headlines in a new font, <a2_0>Times Modern<a2_0/>. The Times was printed in broadsheet format for <a3_0>219 years<a3_0/>, but switched to compact size in <a4_0>2004<a4_0/> in an attempt to appeal more to younger readers and commuters using public transport. The Sunday Times remains a broadsheet.
